Add your content using reStructuredText syntax. See the reStructuredText documentation for details.

class miolo.Diagonal

Bases: mioloObject

A class for diagonal matrices. Initializes a C++ object that stores a diagonal matrix. dim: dimension of square matrix (number of rows is equal to cols) Elements can be acessed via the __getitem__ method, ie Diagonal[k]

Vector space +- are defined. Scalar multiplication and division are also defined via */ operator. Matrix multiplication can be done for Matrix, Graph and Digraph objects via the & operator.

cols
ctype
rows
class miolo.Digraph

Bases: mioloObject

A class for directed graphs.

nodes: number of nodes in graph ctype: underlying ctype.

Vector space operators +- are defined for graphs with same number of edges. Multiplication and division by scalar is defined. Matrix multiplication can be done with objects of type Matrix, returning another matrix.

connect(self, unsigned long i, unsigned long j, double value=0)

Create connection from i to j weighted by value.

copy(self, mode='whole')

Returns a copy of self. if mode is whole, returns a copy of the whole Digraph. If mode is structure, returns a Digraph with same structure of self, but with all weights set to zero.

ctype
nodes
null
sameShape(self, Digraph G)

Checks if both Digraphs have the same shapes.

shape(self)

Returns the number of nonzero elements of each row in the adjacency matrix.

symmetrize(self)

Returns a Digraph with the symmetrization of self.

transpose(self)

Matrix transposition of Digraphs.

class miolo.Euclidean

Bases: Manifold

distance(self, Matrix A)

Euclidean distance between rows of A.

dot(self, Matrix A)

Dot product between rows of A. This is different from miolo.dot, that computes the frobenius dot product between matrices.

gaussianNormalize(self, Matrix A)

Returns A normalized to have columns with mean 0 and variance 1.

mean(self, Matrix A)

Returns a row Matrix which is the mean of the rows of A.

minmaxNormalize(self, Matrix A)

For each column, calculates min and max values, and then returns a matrix for which each element is (A_ij-min_j)/(max_j-min_j).

rowNormalize(self, Matrix A)

Returns A with rows normalized to sum 1.

variance(self, Matrix A)

Returns a row Matrix which is the variance of the rows of A.

class miolo.Graph

Bases: mioloObject

A class for undirected graphs. Initializes a C++ object that stores a sparse weighted adjacency matrix. nodes: number of nodes in Graph edges: number of edges in Graph ctype: underlying C type for Graph weights

Vector space operators +- are defined for graphs with same number of edges. Multiplication and division by scalar is defined. Matrix multiplication can be done with objects of type Matrix, returning another matrix.

ctype
degree(self)

Returns a column Matrix where each entry is the degree of the corresponding verterx.

edges
isolatedNodes(self)
laplacian(self)

Returns the graph corresponding to the normalized laplacian of current graph.

nodes
normalize(self)

Symmetric normalization of edge weights.

propagate(self, Matrix M, bool[:] clamped=None)

When clamped is None, returns the matrix product of self and M. When clamped is not None, it acts as a copy indicator: if clamped[i] is True, row i of M is copied to output. If clamped[i] is False, matrix multiplication is done as usual. clamped must have length equal to M.rows.

structure

Returns the pairs of existing edges in graph as a numpy array. This works both as a getter and a setter.

toDigraph(self)

Returns a Matrix corresponding to the dense representation of self.

toMatrix(self)

Returns a Matrix corresponding to the dense representation of self.

weights

Returns the pairs weights of edges in graph as a numpy array. This works both as a getter and a setter.

class miolo.Hyperbolic(c=1)

Bases: Manifold

This class treats each row of a Matrix as a point in the Poincare disk. Convertions to and from the Klein model are also available.

distance(self, Matrix M)

Return a square Matrix for which each entry is the geodesic distance between the pair of (i,j) rows of M.

exp(self, Matrix at, Matrix M)

Mobius addition.

hyperbolicity(self, Matrix M)

Returns the Gromov hiperbolicity of the rows of M.

isIn(self, Matrix M)

Check if rows of M belong to the M.cols-dimensional Poincare Disk.

log(self, Matrix start, Matrix end)

Mobius addition.

madd(self, Matrix A, Matrix B)

Mobius addition.

mean(self, Matrix M)

Returns the Einstein Midpoint of rows of M.

class miolo.KmeansUtil

Bases: object

euclideanCentroid(self, Matrix data, Matrix labels)
euclideanCentroidDistance(self, Matrix data, Matrix center)
hyperbolicCentroidDistance(self, Matrix data, Matrix center)
partition(self, Matrix data, Matrix labels, int labelNum)
seed(self, Matrix data, int k_centroids)

Runs k-means++ to return seeds for k-means. This is done using euclidean distance. data: data matrix k_centroids: number of centroids desired.

sphereCentroidDistance(self, Matrix data, Matrix center)
class miolo.Manifold

Bases: object

class miolo.Matrix

Bases: mioloObject

A class for dense matrices. Initializes a C++ object that stores a dense matrix. rows: number of rows of Matrix cols: number of cols of Matrix ctype: underlying C type for Matrix data

Operators +-*/ are defined between matrices and scalars to replicate vector space operations. Matrix multiplication is done via the __and__ and __rand__ operators (&). Absolute value operator __abs__ is also overloaded and returns the max absolute value of elements of matrix.

argmax(self)

Returns the argmax of each row.

argmin(self)

Returns the argmin of each row.

cols
copy(self, Matrix M, unsigned long[:] only=None)

Copies M into self if both have same shape. only: if not None, copies only rows in only.

ctype
cut(self, unsigned long[:] targets)

Returns a new Matrix consisting of selected rows of self. targets: indexes of rows to be returned.

flatten(self, bool rows=True)

Inplace flattening of a Matrix. If rows is True, Matrix is flattened to have a single row. If rows is False, flattened to a single column. NOTE: This only changes a view on the Matrix data. No changes are made on stored data.

max(self)

Returns max value in matrix.

min(self)

Returns min value in matrix.

normalize(self)

Row normalization in to make elements in the same row sum to 1. This operation is done inplace.

null
numpy

Interaction with numpy.

print(self)
reshape(self, unsigned long rows, unsigned long cols)

Inplace reshape of a Matrix. Can be done only if rows*cols is equal to self.rows*self.cols. NOTE: This only changes a ‘view’ on the Matrix data. No changes are made on stored data.

rowDistance(self)

Returns the self.rows x self.rows Matrix for which each entry (i,j) is the euclidean distance between rows i and j of self.

rows
sumAll(self)

Returns the sum of all elements in a Matrix.

transpose(self)

Returns the transpose of a Matrix.

class miolo.Sphere(tmax=1000, precision=0.005)

Bases: Manifold

This class treats each row of a Matrix as a unit sphere. Therefore, it views a Matrix as the product manifold of Matrix.rows unit spheres embedded in the euclidean space of dimension Matrix.cols. Initialization parameters are relative to the mean calculation algorithm

coordinateReady(self, Matrix M, unsigned long azimuth=0)

Transforms M in order to make its rows suitable spherical coordinates. First, minmax normalization is done and then columns are multiplied by PI, with the exception of azimuth, which is multiplied by 2*PI

distance(self, Matrix M)

Return a square Matrix for which each entry is the geodesic distance between the pair of (i,j) rows of M.

exp(self, Matrix at, Matrix tangent)

Exponential map on the unit sphere. at: point on the sphere tangent: a tangent vector of at. Note: no checking is done for either at or tangent. Ensure before applying.

fromEuclidean(self, Matrix M)

Returns the Matrix for which each row r has M.cols+1 columns and is the mapping of the r row of M to the sphere embedded in the euclidean space of dimension M.cols+1.

isIn(self, Matrix M, double tolerance=0.001)

Checks if each row of M is on the unit sphere. tolerance: numerical tolerance for acceptance.

isTangent(self, Matrix at, Matrix M, double tolerance=0.001)

Checks if each row of M is on the tangent space of the corresponding row of at. tolerance: numerical tolerance for acceptance.

log(self, Matrix start, Matrix end)

Logarithmic map on the sphere. start: starting point on the sphere end: ending point on the sphere. Neither start or end are checked. Ensure before using.

mean(self, Matrix M, Matrix init=None)

Returns a row Matrix which is the Riemmaninan mean of rows of M. This is done via an interative algorithm. init: starting point for the algorithm Control parameters are stored in self.tmax and self.precision.

stereographicProjection(self, Matrix M)

Returns the matrix for which each row is the stereographic projection of the corresponding row in M over the sphere.

tangentProjection(self, Matrix at, Matrix M)

Returns the matrix for which each row r is the projection of the r-th row in M onto the tangent space of the r-th row of at.

toEuclidean(self, Matrix M)

Returns the Matrix for which each row r has M.cols-1 columns and is the mapping of the r row of M to the sphere embedded in the euclidean space of dimension M.cols+1.

miolo.concat(Matrix A, Matrix B)

Concatenates A and B if both have same number of columns and share same ctype. Rowise concatenation is performed.

miolo.dot(Matrix A, Matrix B)

Frobenius dot product between two matrices.

miolo.hadamard(Graph G, Graph H)

Hadamard (element-wise) product between weights in Graphs. Both graphs must have same number of edges. Structure of G will be the structure of the returning graph.

class miolo.mioloObject

Bases: object

A container object for four objects in the miolo library. This is usually not useful outside Cython.

cols
ctype
dim
isDiagonal(self)

Returns true if object is miolo.Digraph

isDigraph(self)

Returns true if object is miolo.Digraph

isGraph(self)

Returns true if object is miolo.Graph.

isMatrix(self)

Returns true if object is a miolo.Matrix.

nodes
rows
miolo.txtGraph(filename, ctype=global_ctype)

Loads Graph from txt file. Uses numpy. It is expected a file consisting of rows of triplets (i,j,w), the two first being unsigned integers and w the weight of corresponde edge.

miolo.txtMatrix(filename, ctype=global_ctype)

Loads Matrix from txt file. Uses numpy.
